footer-item.tezblock: tezblock is a block explorer for Tezos an open-source platform for assets and applications backed by a global community of validators, researchers, and builders.

resources-wallets.introduction_1: A list of wallets that support the Tezos protocol for transactions, delegations or other operations. Please help us to keep the list updated and

airgap.title: AirGap
airgap.description: With AirGap your old smartphone is your new ‘hardware wallet’. Securely store your XTZ with the unique two device approach where one device is completely offline, delegate your Tezzies from cold storage and earn rewards. AirGap's focus is on accessible security, providing best in class security while maintaing a great user experience.
airgap.features: Offline device, Highest security, XTZ delegation, Coin agnostic, Secure storage, Social recovery, Hot wallet option

atomic.title: Atomic Wallet
atomic.description: Atomic is a decentralized wallet that supports 300+ cryptocurrency assets. Strong encryption and custody-free solution guarantee their users the highest level of security. Atomic Wallet provides instant exchange and 'buy crypto with a credit card' feature.
atomic.features: Buy Cryptocurrency (Visa, Master card), Exchange option, XTZ delegation

atomex.title: Atomex
atomex.description: Multicurrency HD wallet with built-in hybrid atomic swap exchange.
atomex.features: HD wallet, built-in hybrid atomic swap DEX

cortez.title: Cortez
cortez.description: Mobile wallet developed by Nomadic Labs.

galleon.title: Galleon
galleon.description: Galleon is a smart wallet for Tezos. Galleon is a deployment of Tezori, an open source wallet framework for Tezos, supporting both software and hardware wallets in eight languages on Mac, Windows and Linux.

kukai.title: Kukai
kukai.description: One of the first Tezos wallets with offline-signing, KT backward compatibility and ledger support. Kukai is available in 6 different languages thanks to the Tezos community efforts. The wallet has been audited by one of the leading security audit German firm. Kukai guarantees full anonymity as there is no tracking, cookies or analytics in their wallet.

magnum.title: Magnum Wallet
magnum.description: Magnum Wallet is a multicurrency non-custodial wallet service. Designed for those who wish to manage their crypto portfolio in a secure and convenient interface, it also lets the user earn rewards through staking or by claiming forks and bounty airdrops. As part of their “Multiply Your Funds” paradigm, the team is always on the lookout for new ways to benefit the users.
magnum.features: Blockchain Agnostic, In-App Exchange, Hardware Wallets, Ultimate Security, Passive Income, Forks & Bounties

paytomat.title: paytomat
paytomat.description: paytomat is a non-custodial wallet that brings financial services that modern customers eager. From exchanging assets, to referral programs, to trading BEP-2 tokens or accessing dApps and games, paytomat supports over 14 cryptocurrencies and covers all of a user's wants and needs in one single app.

simplestacking.title: simplestacking.com
simplestacking.description: Safe way to store & stake Tezos. Desktop & Web wallet with Trezor support.
simplestacking.features: Trezor T, multiple wallets, wallet balance history

tezbox.title: TezBox
tezbox.description: TezBox was the earliest functional GUI wallet for Tezos. TezBox has grown to be one of the major community developed wallets and will continue to provide users and developers with an easy to use, powerful and secure wallet.
tezbox.features: Secure, Mobile, Developer Friendly, Open Source, Hardware Wallet Support

block-detail.invalid-block_text: This block level is not valid.
block-detail.block-height_tooltip: The block height, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of the new block.
block-detail.baker_tooltip: A Baker takes part in the validation of the network.
block-detail.timestamp_tooltip: The date and time at which a block was created.
block-detail.value_tooltip: The total amount of Tezzies included in transactions for this block.
block-detail.transaction-fees_tooltip: The total amount of fees spent for transactions in this block.
block-detail.endorsed-slots_tooltip: A block has to be enndorsed by other bakers, up to 32 bakers confirm that this block is valid.
block-detail.cycle_tooltip: A Cycle is a set of consecutive blocks consisting out of 4095 blocks. Cycles are used as a unit of “time” in the block chain. For example, the different phases in the amendment voting procedures are defined based on cycles.
block-detail.cycle-position_tooltip: The position in number of blocks out of 4095 blocks.
block-detail.fitness_tooltip: Fitness is a metric used to compare contexts. For example, when several blocks claim to be heads of the chain, their context’s fitness are compared. The block with the highest fitness is selected as the head of the chain.
block-detail.protocol_tooltip: The active protcol of this block. The protocol can be changed through the protocol amendment proccess.

transaction-detail.invalid-operation-hash_text: This hash is currently invalid, it might not yet have been included in the blockchain.
transaction-detail.invalid-operation-hash_update: This page continuously updates to get the latest state.
transaction-detail.transaction-hash_tooltip: An identifier that is generated on transaction creation, used to uniquely identify a particular transaction.
transaction-detail.block_tooltip: The block height at which this transaction was included into the blockchain.
transaction-detail.timestamp_tooltip: The date and time at which this transaction was included in a block.
transaction-detail.value_tooltip: The total amount of Tezzies included in this transaction.
transaction-detail.transaction-fees_tooltip: The total amount of fees spent for transactions in this block.

account-detail.related-accounts_tooltip: Accounts that are either managed by this account or are the manager of this account.
account-detail.no-related-accounts: This account has no related accounts.
account-detail.not-delegated: This account has not been delegated.
account-detail.not-delegated_text: Delegate to a baker and contribute to the network validation and receive a reward back.
account-detail.delegated-account_tooltip: The first delegated account that is managed by this account. This can be the same account or an account that starts with KT1.
account-detail.amount_tooltip: The account balance of the delegated account shown above.
account-detail.next-reward-expected_tooltip: The time until the next reward is exptected to be paid out by the baker.
account-detail.reward-amount_tooltip: The amount being paid out as reward by the baker for the delegation. This is the expected amount to be paid out, the baker split is alreay subtracted.
account-detail.baker_tooltip: A Baker takes part in the validation of the network with his balance and the balances of delegations.
account-detail.baker-split_tooltip: The baker split is a percentage taken by the baker as a reward for running his infrastrucutre. This split is decided by the baker, happens offchain and could also be 0%.
account-detail.invalid-address_text: This address is currently not visible on the blockchain.

contract-detail.name: Name
contract-detail.invalid-address_text: This address is currently not visible on the blockchain.

proposal-detail.details-of-proposal: Details of Proposal on Tezos Agora
proposal-detail.period-has-ended: period has ended, period was between

telegram-modal-component.title: Telegram Tezos Notifier Bot
telegram-modal-component.text_2: , you can stay up-to-date about accounts and be notified for delegations, transactions and much more directly in Telegram.
telegram-modal-component.notified-about: You'll be notified about the following address
telegram-modal-component.placeholder: Enter a name for this address
telegram-modal-component.name-too-long: The name can only have 18 characters

search-item.label: Search
search-item.placeholder: Search by Address / Alias / Transaction / Block
